docs.lead_paragraph: Green and yellow pattypans are perfect for stuffing with a simple mixture of squash, corn and onion.
docs.snippet: Green and yellow pattypans are perfect for stuffing with a simple mixture of squash, corn and onion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The large spherical couscous that we know as Israeli couscous actually has its origins in North Africa.

headline.main: Stuffed Yellow Peppers With Israeli Couscous and Pesto
headline.print_headline: Stuffed Yellow Peppers With Israeli Couscous and Pesto

docs.snippet: The large spherical couscous that we know as Israeli couscous actually has its origins in North Africa.

docs.lead_paragraph: Even among children who had been breast-fed for six months or longer, a study turned up no evidence that breast-feeding prevented eczema or limited its severity.

headline.seo: Study Says Breast-Feeding Has No Effect on Eczema
headline.main: Nutrition: Breast-Feeding Does Not Prevent Eczema
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: Breast-Feeding Does Not Prevent Eczema

docs.abstract: Carsten Flohr study published online in The British Journal of Dermatology finds no evidence that prolonged breastfeeding protects infants against developing eczema or other allergic diseases.
docs.snippet: Even among children who had been breast-fed for six months or longer, a study turned up no evidence that breast-feeding prevented eczema or limited its severity.

docs.lead_paragraph: An analysis of seven studies on chocolate and cardiovascular health suggest that high consumption can reduce the risk of several ailments, but the none of the studies involve randomized controlled trials.

headline.seo: High Chocolate Consumption Drops Heart Risk, Studies Suggest
headline.main: Prevention: Evidence of Heart Benefits From Chocolate
headline.print_headline: Prevention: Evidence of Heart Benefits From Chocolate

docs.abstract: Dr Oscar H Franco study published in journal BMJ finds high levels of chocolate consumption are associated with significant reduction in the risk of certain cardiovascular disorders.
docs.snippet: An analysis of seven studies on chocolate and cardiovascular health suggest that high consumption can reduce the risk of several ailments, but the none of the studies involve randomized controlled trials.

docs.lead_paragraph: The reasons for the increase are not clear, but people who receive devices like pacemakers and defibrillators tend to be older and in poorer health.

headline.seo: Cardiac Implantations Increase, and Infections Follow
headline.main: Risks: Infections Follow Rise in Cardiac Implants
headline.print_headline: Risks: Infections Follow Rise in Cardiac Implants

docs.abstract: Dr Arnold J Greenspan study published in The Journal of the American College of Cardiology finds that the number of infections associated with implantable cardiac devices has tripled since 1993.
docs.snippet: The reasons for the increase are not clear, but people who receive devices like pacemakers and defibrillators tend to be older and in poorer health.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ocean temperatures may have increased, but nutrients washed downriver by flooding seems to have been a greater driving force behind cholera’s rise.

headline.main: Cholera: Climate Change Isn’t a Culprit in Increasing Outbreaks, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Cholera: Climate Change Isn’t a Culprit In Increasing Outbreaks, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study published in The American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene finds that the marked rise in cholera outbreaks is not a result of rising ocean temperatures from global warming but a result of a more complicated fallout from flooding cycles.
docs.snippet: Ocean temperatures may have increased, but nutrients washed downriver by flooding seems to have been a greater driving force behind cholera’s rise.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers at Northwestern University identified a possible culprit for Lou Gehrig’s disease — also known as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or A.L.S.

headline.seo: Possible Culprit Identified in Lou Gehrig’s Disease (A.L.S.)
headline.main: Possible Culprit Is Found for Lou Gehrig’s Disease
headline.print_headline: Possible Culprit Is Found for Lou Gehrig’s Disease

docs.abstract: In Theory column investigates hypothesis that accumulation of neural proteins causes Lou Gehrig's disease.
docs.snippet: Researchers at Northwestern University identified a possible culprit for Lou Gehrig’s disease — also known as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or A.L.S.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two new books — one on prostate cancer, the other on the sad state of medicine today — take a patient-centric approach.

headline.seo: Two Doctors Take a Patient-Centric Approach in New Books
headline.main: Doctors With Plenty of Time for Patients
headline.print_headline: Doctors With Plenty of Time for Patients

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews books After Prostate Cancer: A What-Comes-Next Guide to a Safe and Informed Recovery by Dr Arnold Melman and Rosemary E Newnham and Doctor, Your Patient Will See You Now: Gaining the Upper hand in Your Medical Care by Dr Steven Z Kussin.
docs.snippet: Two new books — one on prostate cancer, the other on the sad state of medicine today — take a patient-centric approach.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two tiny groups are offering medication and vocational training to change attitudes in a country where people with epilepsy are often considered uneducable and unemployable.

headline.seo: Advocates Battle Stigma of Epilepsy in Sierra Leone
headline.main: Stigma Is Toughest Foe in an Epilepsy Fight
headline.print_headline: Stigma Is Toughest Foe in an Epilepsy Fight

docs.abstract: Epilepsy Project in Sierra Leone is offering medication and vocational training in effort to to change attitudes toward the disorder in a nation where people with epilepsy are often considered ineducable and unemployable.
docs.snippet: Two tiny groups are offering medication and vocational training to change attitudes in a country where people with epilepsy are often considered uneducable and unemployable.
